newsitem.title: INDIA: India's United Front, Congress adjourn talks.
newsitem.headline: India's United Front, Congress adjourn talks.

text.p: India's ruling United Front coalition said on Thursday it had adjourned talks with the Congress party to settle a political crisis, and the two formations would discuss proposals with their party leaders.

"We have to go back and discuss the proposals with the respective parties. Many proposals are there," Harkishen Singh Surjeet, a United Front negotiator, told reporters after the two sides held 90 minutes of talks.

It was not clear whether the two political formations, which launched make-or-break talks on Wednesday, would hold another round before a vote of confidence in Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda set in parliament for Friday.
United Front negotiator Chandrababu Naidu, asked what the proposals were, said: "We will discuss it at the (United Front) Steering Committee and take a final decision."
The decision-making Steering Committee was expected to meet later on Thursday.
"Discussions are going on," Congress negotiator Madhavrao Scindia said after the morning talks ended.
